How to Install mono-tools-devel on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mono-tools-devel

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mono-tools-devel on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mono-tools-devel on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mono-tools-devel in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mono-tools-devel, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mono-tools-devel Using apt

To install mono-tools-devel in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mono-tools-devel using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mono-tools-devel

The installation of mono-tools-devel might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mono-tools-devel Using apt-get

To install mono-tools-devel using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mono-tools-devel.

sudo apt-get -y install mono-tools-devel

Install mono-tools-devel Using Synaptic

To install mono-tools-devel using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mono-tools-devel on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mono-tools-devel. This will display the mono-tools-devel package in the package window, now to install mono-tools-devel, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mono-tools-devel package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mono-tools-devel.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mono-tools-devel Using aptitude

To install mono-tools-devel on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mono-tools-devel.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mono-tools-devel using the command aptitude install mono-tools-devel.

sudo aptitude -y install mono-tools-devel

How to Upgrade mono-tools-devel on debian

If you want to upgrade the mono-tools-devel package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mono-tools-devel using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mono-tools-devel to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mono-tools-devel.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mono-tools-devel sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mono-tools-devel

Upgrade mono-tools-devel using Aptitude

To upgrade mono-tools-devel using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mono-tools-devel.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mono-tools-devel

Upgrade mono-tools-devel using Synaptic

To upgrade mono-tools-devel using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mono-tools-devel, now right-click mono-tools-devel, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mono-tools-devel just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mono-tools-devel on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mono-tools-devel from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mono-tools-devel, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mono-tools-devel

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mono-tools-devel

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mono-tools-devel you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mono-tools-devel

Remove mono-tools-devel using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mono-tools-devel using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mono-tools-devel, right-click the mono-tools-devel package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mono-tools-devel click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mono-tools-devel on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mono-tools-devel using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mono-tools-devel then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
